page.title: 04Farming in Yarlet Area
page.content: He also has a small number of Limousin calves. Each day a tanker lorry from the Milk Marketing Board takes away about 100 gallons of milk, which goes to Walsall in the West Midlands. From the farm also, go older cows and spare calves, which are sold in the market at either Stone or Uttoxeter. To the farm comes special cattle food, fertiliser, any machinery and straw for bedding from Norfolk. The buildings, which mainly date from the early 1920's are very compact and consist of the farm house, the milking parlor, the dairy, a Dutch barn for storage, and two other buildings for machinery and calves. To work the farm, Mr veron has a tractor, hay mower and turner, a chain harrow, muck spreader, bailer, trailer and fertiliser spreader, with also
